an4.103:4.3: ~Covered but empty, ~uncovered but full, ~uncovered and empty, and ~covered and full.
an4.103:4.5: In the same way, these four people similar to pots are found in the world.
an4.103:4.7: ~Covered but empty, ~uncovered but full, ~uncovered and empty, and ~covered and full.
an4.103:5.1: And how is a person covered but empty?
an4.103:5.2: It’s when a person is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.
an4.103:5.3: But they don’t truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an4.103:5.4: That’s how a person is covered but empty.
an4.103:5.5: That person is like a pot that’s covered but empty, I say.
an4.103:6.1: And how is a person uncovered but full?
an4.103:6.2: It’s when a person is not impressive …
an4.103:6.3: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.103:7.1: And how is a person uncovered and empty?
an4.103:7.2: It’s when a person is not impressive …
an4.103:7.3: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.103:8.1: And how is a person covered and full?
an4.103:8.2: It’s when a person is impressive …
an4.103:8.3: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.103:8.7: These four people similar to pots are found in the world.”
